titleStmt.title: Nevv Mexico. Otherwise, The voiage of Anthony of Espeio who in the yeare 1583. with his company, discouered a lande of 15. prouinces, replenished with townes and villages, with houses of 4. or 5. stories height, it lieth northward, and some suppose that the same way men may by places inhabited go to the lande tearmed Deʻ Labrador. Translated out of the Spanish copie printed first at Madreel, 1586, and afterward at Paris, in the same yeare.
Historia de las cosas mas notables de la China. English. Selections
titleStmt.author: González de Mendoza, Juan, 1545-1618.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A68498 of text S110080 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 18487). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 40 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 17 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Otherwise, The voiage of Anthony of Espeio who in the yeare 1583. with his company, discouered a lande of 15. prouinces, replenished with townes and villages, with houses of 4. or 5. stories height, it lieth northward, and some suppose that the same way men may by places inhabited go to the lande tearmed Deʻ Labrador. Translated out of the Spanish copie printed first at Madreel, 1586, and afterward at Paris, in the same yeare.

titleStmt.author: González de Mendoza, Juan, 1545-1618.
Loyola, Marín Ignacio de, d. 1606. aut
Avanzi, Francesco.

notesStmt.note: A translation of an extract of "Historia de las cosas mas notables de la China" by Juan Gonzáles de Mendoza. The section extracted was chiefly based on accounts by Martín Ignacio de Loyola.
Translator's dedication signed: A.F. = Francesco Avanzi.
Printer's name conjectured and publication date supplied by STC.
Running title reads: The discouerie of New Mexico.
Reproductions of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 387 and at reel 967 (same photostat filmed twice).

keywords.term: Indians of North America -- New Mexico -- Early works to 1800.
New Mexico -- Description and travel -- Early works to 1800.
